enWisdom: Piety is better than the disgrace of avarice
The cornerstone of piety is abandoning covetousness
The uprightness of faith is [in] piety and its corruption is [in] greed

Wisdom: عَلَيْكَ بِالْوَرَعِ وَإِيَّاكَ وَغُرُورَ الطَّمَعِ فَإِنَّهُ وَخِيمُ الْمَرْتَعِ
enWisdom: Espouse piety and beware of the deception of avarice, for indeed it is a pasture without herbage
The trouble for religion is covetousness and its rectitude is [in] piety

Wisdom: وَرَعٌ يُنْجِي خَيْرٌ مِنْ طَمَعٍ يُرْدِي
enWisdom: The piety that saves is better than the avarice that ruins

Wisdom: وَرَعٌ يُعِزُّ خَيْرٌ مِنْ طَمَعٍ يُذِلُّ
enWisdom: The piety that dignifies is better than the avarice that humiliates
Cupidity corrupts piety and licentiousness [corrupts] God-wariness

Wisdom: يُعْجِبُنِي أَنْ يَكُونَ الرَّجُلُ حَسَنَ الْوَرَعِ مُتَنَزِّهاً عَنِ الطَّمَعِ كَثِيرَ الْإِحْسَانِ قَلِيلَ الِامْتِنَانِ
enWisdom: It pleases me for a person to be righteously pious, free from avarice, abundant in kindness and lacking in [making others feel a sense of] obligation
